Exaggerate: The claim that the new legislation removes the right to grow food is false and exaggerated.
Lack enough support: The claim is not supported by any factual evidence or legislation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the new legislation in New Zealand takes away the right to grow food, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim is contradicted by the New Zealand Ministry for Primary Industries spokesperson, who states that the claims made in the screenshot are entirely false and there is no legislation supporting these claims.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no legislation in New Zealand that removes the right to grow food.
Falters at times: The claim has been circulating online since at least 2014, indicating that it has been debunked multiple times but continues to resurface.
Understate: None evident in the provided information.
